article_text:
Government collusion with favored businesses has been a hallmark of the Obama era, and on Monday the Supreme Court has a rare opportunity to rebuke the practice in the name of democratic accountability and the Constitution’s separation of powers.

The case concerns a challenge by private railroads to Congress’s 2008 decision to give Amtrak and the Federal Railroad Administration joint power to regulate the use of railway lines. The private freight railroads claim this amounts to an unlawful delegation of power. They won...

twitter.description: The Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial that the Supreme Court should decide that Congress cannot let a private company regulate its competition.
twitter.title: A Supreme Railroad Job

The private freight railroads claim this amounts to an unlawful delegation of power.
